    • Method Detail

      • hasInHotbar

        public static boolean hasInHotbar(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack,
                                  net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                                  boolean ignoreNBT,
                                  boolean ignoreMetaData)
        States whether the chosen ItemStack is in the EntityPlayers hotbar
        Parameters:
        stack - The ItemStack to check
        player - The EntityPlayer which should have the ItemStack in their hotbar
        ignoreNBT - Whether NBT data should be ignored. Reference - isStackEqual(ItemStack, ItemStack, boolean, boolean)
        ignoreMetaData - Whether meta data should be ignored. Reference - isStackEqual(ItemStack, ItemStack, boolean, boolean)
        Returns:
        Whether the EntityPlayer has the stack in their hotbar

      • isStackEqual

        public static boolean isStackEqual(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack a,
                                   net.minecraft.item.ItemStack b,
                                   boolean ignoreNBT,
                                   boolean ignoreMetaData)
        States whether ItemStack a is the same as ItemStack b
        Parameters:
        a - The first ItemStack
        b - The second ItemStack
        ignoreNBT - Whether NBT data should be ignored. If not, both ItemStacks will need to have the same NBTTagCompound
        ignoreMetaData - Whether meta data should be ignored. If not, both ItemStacks will need to have the same damage
        Returns:
        Whether the two ItemStacks are the same

      • calculateRedstone

        public static int calculateRedstone(net.minecraftforge.items.ItemStackHandler handler)
        Calculate the redstone current from a item stack handler
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler
        Returns:
        The redstone power

      • addStackToInventory

        public static net.minecraft.item.ItemStack addStackToInventory(net.minecraftforge.items.IItemHandler handler,
                                                               net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack,
                                                               boolean simulate)
        Adds the chosen item stack to the inventory
        Parameters:
        handler - The holder of the items
        stack - The stack to add
        simulate - Is the task a simulation?
        Returns:
        The remainder left if the slot was full

      • addStackToInventory

        public static net.minecraft.item.ItemStack addStackToInventory(net.minecraftforge.items.IItemHandler handler,
                                                               int maxSlot,
                                                               net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack,
                                                               boolean simulate)
        Adds the chosen item stack to the inventory
        Parameters:
        handler - The holder of the items
        maxSlot - The max slot to add to
        stack - The stack to add
        simulate - Is the task a simulation?
        Returns:
        The remainder left if the slot was full

      • isInventoryFull

        public static boolean isInventoryFull(net.minecraftforge.items.IItemHandler handler)
        Checks if the inventory is full
        Parameters:
        handler - The inventory
        Returns:
        true if it is full

      • isInventoryFull

        public static boolean isInventoryFull(net.minecraftforge.items.IItemHandler handler,
                                      int maxSlot)
        Checks if the inventory is full
        Parameters:
        handler - The inventory
        maxSlot - The number of slots to check
        Returns:

      • getColourFromDye

        public static net.minecraft.item.EnumDyeColor getColourFromDye(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack)
        Gets the correct colour from any item stack using the ore dictionary The item must be registered as a dye
        Parameters:
        stack - The ItemStack to test
        Returns:
        The EnumDyeColor of the ItemStack to test. If the stack is not registered as a dye, the EnumDyeColor.WHITE will be used
